intro: Piper san-joseanum, commonly known as the San José pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces small, peppery fruits that are used in traditional medicine and local cuisines. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
